title: How to Use Queso Fresco

methods.name: Using Queso Fresco as a Filling

steps.headline: Make your own Chiles Rellenos with queso fresco as a filling.
steps.description: Fill roasted chile peppers with a protein-based filling of your choice, such as refried beans. Mix 2 cups (470 mL) of this filling with 2 cups (244 g) of queso fresco, and spoon the mixture into the sliced chiles. If you’d prefer a meatier recipe, use ground beef instead of refried beans. Chiles Rellenos taste especially great when garnished with salsa.

steps.headline: Fill your quesadillas with queso fresco.
steps.description: Prepare your tortillas by heating them in the microwave for at least 10 seconds. Slice off a thin, 3 millimetres (0.12 in) wide slice of cheese that fits within the diameter of your warmed tortillas. Fold the tortilla in half, and top it with some salsa for extra flavor! If you want to fit exactly one slice of queso fresco into a quesadilla, buy smaller corn tortillas at the supermarket. Don’t try to put the cheese on the tortilla before heating it. Unlike other soft cheeses, queso fresco does not melt well, and is better served sliced or crumbled.

steps.headline: Prepare some tasty enchiladas stuffed with queso fresco.
steps.description: Assemble your ingredients and dip the corn tortillas into the enchilada sauce as you normally would. Before rolling up your enchiladas, spoon some crumbled queso fresco into the center of each tortilla. For 4 servings of enchiladas, divide 2½ cups (305 g) of queso fresco between 8 tortillas. Enchiladas taste great when garnished with fresh vegetables like lettuce and radishes, as well as sour cream!

steps.headline: Crumble some queso fresco over your Huevos Rancheros.
steps.description: Set a warmed flour tortilla onto a plate and fill it with a variety of beans, peppers, and tomatoes. The specific ingredients may vary per recipe, but many standard dishes include pinto beans, diced tomatoes, green chiles, and cooked eggs. Layer on these items until they fill the center of the tortilla, leaving only 1 inch (2.5 cm) of uncovered space around the edge. Sprinkle some crumbled queso fresco over the top as a finishing touch. Each tortilla will have about ¼ cup (30.5 g) of queso fresco on it.

steps.headline: Top off a light corn salad with some crumbled queso fresco.
steps.description: Prepare a corn salad, or whatever type of salad you prefer the most. A typical corn salad contains a variety of diced vegetables, including peppers, onions, and chiles. Once you’ve finished assembling the ingredients into your own salad, combine the vegetables in a bowl along with 2 cups (244 g) of queso fresco. Be sure to toss the salad afterwards so the cheese is spread evenly throughout.

steps.headline: Sprinkle some queso fresco over some spicy soup.
steps.description: Finish off an especially heavy or spicy soup with some mild, creamy cheese. After ladling soup into 4 bowls, divide ¼ cup of queso fresco over the surface, along with some other vegetables and garnishes. If you can’t decide on a fresh topping for your soup, use a combination of onion, cilantro, and avocado—these will taste great with the queso fresco and balance it out well. For example, try sprinkling some queso fresco over a bowl of lime avocado soup.

steps.headline: Add some crumbled queso fresco on top of your refried beans.
steps.description: Create your refried bean mixture with a combination of pinto beans, garlic cloves, onions, bell peppers, and pork. Once the ingredients are cooked and refried, ladle the finished product onto a plate. Crumbling some queso fresco on top helps add a lightness and creaminess to the otherwise heavier dish. In addition to queso fresco, you can also add some salsa or pico de gallo to your refried beans.

steps.headline: Mix salsa and queso fresco together to make a delicious dip.
steps.description: Create your own spin on chile con queso by combining premade salsa and queso fresco together. Cut a chunk of queso fresco in half and place both pieces in a dish. Pour the salsa and any other ingredients of your choice on top of the cheese, and refrigerate the dip for 2 hours to let the flavors soak in. To give the queso fresco a slightly softer texture, trying microwaving the dish for about 3 minutes before serving. Cilantro and hot peppers are great toppings to use in this dip.

steps.headline: Ladle some queso fresco over a serving of cinnamon tamal.
steps.description: Prepare a pan of tamal by placing a foil covered 8 by 8 inches (20 by 20 cm) baking pan in a larger pan filled with water. Bake the batter at 325 °F (163 °C) for at least 1 hour and 15 minutes, or until the tamal is cooked all the way through. Combine 1 cup (240 mL) of crème fraîche and ⅔ cup (95 g) of queso fresco together in a bowl, and spoon it over a slice of the tamal. If you want to add some extra spice to your tamal, sprinkle some cinnamon over each slice. A tamal is like a sweeter cake version of a tamale.

steps.headline: Add ¾ cup (91.5 g) of queso fresco to your sugar cookie dough.
steps.description: Change up your sugar cookie recipe by adding in some queso fresco! While not as sweet as cream cheese, queso fresco adds a nice depth to these simple treats. Mix the cheese in with the other ingredients and form the dough into balls on a cookie sheet. Bake them for at least 9 minutes at 350 °F (177 °C), and let them cool on a wire rack. Before moving the cookies to a wire rack, let them cool down on the cookie sheet for around 2 minutes first.

steps.headline: Include queso fresco in your cheesecake to give it a unique flavor.
steps.description: Add your own spin to this rich dessert by mixing in 4 oz (113.4 g) of queso fresco in with your cream cheese. The queso fresco adds a slightly salty taste to the cheesecake, giving it an interesting and delicious flavor profile. To complement the taste of queso fresco, drizzle some caramel sauce of each slice of cheesecake.

text: Using Queso Fresco as a Filling Make your own Chiles Rellenos with queso fresco as a filling. Fill roasted chile peppers with a protein-based filling of your choice, such as refried beans. Mix 2 cups (470 mL) of this filling with 2 cups (244 g) of queso fresco, and spoon the mixture into the sliced chiles. If you’d prefer a meatier recipe, use ground beef instead of refried beans. Chiles Rellenos taste especially great when garnished with salsa. Fill your quesadillas with queso fresco. Prepare your tortillas by heating them in the microwave for at least 10 seconds. Slice off a thin, 3 millimetres (0.12 in) wide slice of cheese that fits within the diameter of your warmed tortillas. Fold the tortilla in half, and top it with some salsa for extra flavor! If you want to fit exactly one slice of queso fresco into a quesadilla, buy smaller corn tortillas at the supermarket. Don’t try to put the cheese on the tortilla before heating it. Unlike other soft cheeses, queso fresco does not melt well, and is better served sliced or crumbled. Prepare some tasty enchiladas stuffed with queso fresco. Assemble your ingredients and dip the corn tortillas into the enchilada sauce as you normally would. Before rolling up your enchiladas, spoon some crumbled queso fresco into the center of each tortilla. For 4 servings of enchiladas, divide 2½ cups (305 g) of queso fresco between 8 tortillas. Enchiladas taste great when garnished with fresh vegetables like lettuce and radishes, as well as sour cream! Topping Entrees and Side Dishes Crumble some queso fresco over your Huevos Rancheros. Set a warmed flour tortilla onto a plate and fill it with a variety of beans, peppers, and tomatoes. The specific ingredients may vary per recipe, but many standard dishes include pinto beans, diced tomatoes, green chiles, and cooked eggs. Layer on these items until they fill the center of the tortilla, leaving only 1 inch (2.5 cm) of uncovered space around the edge. Sprinkle some crumbled queso fresco over the top as a finishing touch. Each tortilla will have about ¼ cup (30.5 g) of queso fresco on it. Top off a light corn salad with some crumbled queso fresco. Prepare a corn salad, or whatever type of salad you prefer the most. A typical corn salad contains a variety of diced vegetables, including peppers, onions, and chiles. Once you’ve finished assembling the ingredients into your own salad, combine the vegetables in a bowl along with 2 cups (244 g) of queso fresco. Be sure to toss the salad afterwards so the cheese is spread evenly throughout. Sprinkle some queso fresco over some spicy soup. Finish off an especially heavy or spicy soup with some mild, creamy cheese. After ladling soup into 4 bowls, divide ¼ cup of queso fresco over the surface, along with some other vegetables and garnishes. If you can’t decide on a fresh topping for your soup, use a combination of onion, cilantro, and avocado—these will taste great with the queso fresco and balance it out well. For example, try sprinkling some queso fresco over a bowl of lime avocado soup. Add some crumbled queso fresco on top of your refried beans. Create your refried bean mixture with a combination of pinto beans, garlic cloves, onions, bell peppers, and pork. Once the ingredients are cooked and refried, ladle the finished product onto a plate. Crumbling some queso fresco on top helps add a lightness and creaminess to the otherwise heavier dish. In addition to queso fresco, you can also add some salsa or pico de gallo to your refried beans. Mix salsa and queso fresco together to make a delicious dip. Create your own spin on chile con queso by combining premade salsa and queso fresco together. Cut a chunk of queso fresco in half and place both pieces in a dish. Pour the salsa and any other ingredients of your choice on top of the cheese, and refrigerate the dip for 2 hours to let the flavors soak in. To give the queso fresco a slightly softer texture, trying microwaving the dish for about 3 minutes before serving. Cilantro and hot peppers are great toppings to use in this dip. Enhancing Desserts Ladle some queso fresco over a serving of cinnamon tamal. Prepare a pan of tamal by placing a foil covered 8 by 8 inches (20 by 20 cm) baking pan in a larger pan filled with water. Bake the batter at 325 °F (163 °C) for at least 1 hour and 15 minutes, or until the tamal is cooked all the way through. Combine 1 cup (240 mL) of crème fraîche and ⅔ cup (95 g) of queso fresco together in a bowl, and spoon it over a slice of the tamal. If you want to add some extra spice to your tamal, sprinkle some cinnamon over each slice. A tamal is like a sweeter cake version of a tamale. Add ¾ cup (91.5 g) of queso fresco to your sugar cookie dough. Change up your sugar cookie recipe by adding in some queso fresco! While not as sweet as cream cheese, queso fresco adds a nice depth to these simple treats. Mix the cheese in with the other ingredients and form the dough into balls on a cookie sheet. Bake them for at least 9 minutes at 350 °F (177 °C), and let them cool on a wire rack. Before moving the cookies to a wire rack, let them cool down on the cookie sheet for around 2 minutes first. Include queso fresco in your cheesecake to give it a unique flavor. Add your own spin to this rich dessert by mixing in 4 oz (113.4 g) of queso fresco in with your cream cheese. The queso fresco adds a slightly salty taste to the cheesecake, giving it an interesting and delicious flavor profile. To complement the taste of queso fresco, drizzle some caramel sauce of each slice of cheesecake.
